description: Each record in ED_FOLLOWUP_AUDIT corresponds to a patient's edited follow-up information -- i.e. information for where and when a patient was told to follow up with other providers. This table does not include the current follow-up information.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this edit. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: CM_CT_OWNER_ID
columns.description: The Community ID (CID) of the deployment owner for this contact.

columns.name: PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID associated with the provider record with whom the patient should follow up.

columns.name: CONTACT_INFO
columns.description: The contact information for the patient's follow-up.

columns.name: SUMMARY
columns.description: A summary of the patient contact.

columns.name: EDIT_COUNT
columns.description: Stores the number of units (days/weeks/months) for follow up associated with this contact.

columns.name: ED_FUP_UNIT_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores whether patient has to follow-up in days/weeks/months or on a specific day.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


None specified


Days


Weeks


Months


Date

columns.name: LOC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID number of the office location for the follow-up.

columns.name: ED_FU_PRN_USED_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column shows a 1 if there is something written in the comments field.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes

columns.name: ED_FU_PRN_TEXT
columns.description: The free text entry from the comments field for providers to enter any other information they deem important.

columns.name: DEPARTMENT_ID
columns.description: The Department ID associated with the department with whom the patient should follow up.

columns.name: ED_FU_OTHER
columns.description: The free text entry that contains with whom the patient should follow up.

columns.name: ED_FUP_HOW_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores how the patient should follow up (Call, Make an appointment, etc.).


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


None specified


Call


Make Appointment


Go To

columns.name: USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID associated with the user record who entered this follow-up information.

columns.name: ED_FU_INST
columns.description: The date and time when this follow-up information was filed.

columns.name: ED_FUEDIT_DATE
columns.description: Stores the history of the follow-up dates entered for an encounter.

columns.name: ED_FUEDIT_ADDR_KEY
columns.description: The edit trail for the ED Follow Up Provider Address Key.

columns.name: IP_FUEDIT_ORD_ID
columns.description: The edit trail of the follow-up provider order IDs specified for the encounter
